title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

opener.dateline: Bedford County, Virginia, Goose Creek Monthly Meeting, the 9th of the 9th month, 1797

div.p: Though personally unknown to us, we use the Friendly freedom of writing to thee on account of our worthy friend, thy dear husband Joshua Evans, whom we believe the Lord hath sent forth to labor in his vineyard in those Southern States. And in the course of his religious visit, his lot was eased amongst Friends in those parts, and while within the verge of our monthly meeting his abode was mostly at our house. And we have this to say concerning him: that his company, conversation and conduct adorned the doctrine he delivered to others and endeared him to us and many other Friends who had his company in a private manner. And although he appears singularly led in the narrow way which truly is the way to life, we have no doubt but as he continues faithful therein the Lord will make his way a way of pleasantness and all his paths, paths of peace, shining brighter and brighter unto the perfect day, and bless his gospel labor of love—to the comforting of many of the outcast of Israel and dispersed of Judah—and in the conclusion of time, conduct his immortal soul into mansions of eternal felicity.
We may inform thee that thy beloved husband was in a pretty good state of health when amongst us, which was the latter end of the sixth month and the beginning of the seventh
Not having much more to add, we subscribe ourselves,

closer.salute: friends to thee and thy dear companion,

address.addrLine: n to Evans the of Joshua in the Jersies
To the care of Samuel Fisher
